jot.gui

Class Text

  • java.lang.Object
    • jot.gui.Text

  • public class Text
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple class which uses the TextRenderer to provide informative text (e.g., demo options), overlaid on top of the scene.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Text

        public Text(com.jogamp.opengl.GLDrawable drawable,
            int textSize)
     throws com.jogamp.opengl.GLException
        Creates a new Text with the given font size. An OpenGL context must be current at the time the constructor is called.
        Parameters:
        drawable - the drawable to render the text to.
        textSize - the point size of the font to use.
        Throws:
        com.jogamp.opengl.GLException - if an OpenGL context is not current when the constructor is called.

      • Text

        public Text(com.jogamp.opengl.GLDrawable drawable,
            java.awt.Font font)
     throws com.jogamp.opengl.GLException
        Creates a new Text with the given font. An OpenGL context must be current at the time the constructor is called.
        Parameters:
        drawable - the drawable to render the text to.
        font - the font to use.
        Throws:
        com.jogamp.opengl.GLException - if an OpenGL context is not current when the constructor is called.

      • Text

        public Text(com.jogamp.opengl.GLDrawable drawable,
            java.awt.Font font,
            boolean antialiased,
            boolean useFractionalMetrics)
     throws com.jogamp.opengl.GLException
        Creates a new Text with the given font and rendering attributes. An OpenGL context must be current at the time the constructor is called.
        Parameters:
        drawable - the drawable to render the text to.
        font - the font to use.
        antialiased - whether to use anti-aliased fonts.
        useFractionalMetrics - whether to use fractional font.
        Throws:
        com.jogamp.opengl.GLException - if an OpenGL context is not current when the constructor is called.

    • Method Detail

      • getTextLocation

        public int getTextLocation()
        Gets the relative location where the text of this Text will be drawn: one of UPPER_LEFT, UPPER_RIGHT, LOWER_LEFT, or LOWER_RIGHT. Defaults to LOWER_RIGHT.
        Returns:
        the relative location where the text of this Text will be drawn

      • setTextLocation

        public void setTextLocation(int textLocation)
        Sets the relative location where the text of this Text will be drawn: one of UPPER_LEFT, UPPER_RIGHT, LOWER_LEFT, or LOWER_RIGHT. Defaults to LOWER_RIGHT.
        Parameters:
        textLocation -

      • setColor

        public void setColor(float r,
                     float g,
                     float b,
                     float a)
              throws com.jogamp.opengl.GLException
        Changes the current color of this TextRenderer to the supplied one, where each component ranges from 0.0f - 1.0f. The alpha component, if used, does not need to be premultiplied into the color channels as described in the documentation for Texture, although premultiplied colors are used internally. The default color is opaque white.
        Parameters:
        r - the red component of the new color
        g - the green component of the new color
        b - the blue component of the new color
        a - the alpha component of the new color, 0.0f = completely transparent, 1.0f = completely opaque
        Throws:
        com.jogamp.opengl.GLException - If an OpenGL context is not current when this method is called

      • setText

        public void setText(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> text)
        Set the text to output.
        Parameters:
        text - the ArrayList containing the lines of text to output.

      • setTextLine

        public void setTextLine(java.lang.String textLine)
        Set a text line to output.
        Parameters:
        textLine - to add to the ArrayList containing the lines of text to output.

      • showText

        public void showText()
        Shows in terminal the text to output.

      • render

        public void render()
        Updates the Text's internal timer and counter and draws the computed FPS. It is assumed this method will be called only once per frame.
